meanings.definition: In a way that provides emotional release or purification.
meanings.sent1: She cried cathartically after watching a sad movie.
meanings.sent2: Talking to her best friend always helps her feel better cathartically.
meanings.sent3: The character in the book cathartically let go of all her pent-up emotions through writing.
meanings.sent4: The storm outside raged cathartically, matching her inner turmoil.
meanings.sent5: The art therapy session allowed her to express herself cathartically through painting.

meanings.definition: In a way that acts as a purgative or laxative.
meanings.sent1: The medicine worked cathartically to relieve his constipation.
meanings.sent2: Eating prunes can help regulate your digestion cathartically.
meanings.sent3: The spicy food seemed to work cathartically on his stomach, causing a sudden urge to run to the bathroom.
meanings.sent4: The herbal tea acted cathartically, cleansing his system gently.
meanings.sent5: The fiber-rich diet helped him stay regular cathartically, avoiding any digestive issues.
